title: Piers Morgan suggests Coleen Rooney 'takes advice from Bin Laden'
text:
Coleen claims Rebekah Vardy has been selling stories to the press (Picture: REX)

Piers Morgan has hit back at Coleen Rooney’s belief that sharing secrets on a private social media account should ensure complete privacy.

Suggesting Coleen ‘take a leaf out of Osama Bin Laden’s book’ – Bin Laden took ten years to catch and kill because he only trusted a select few and shared nothing online – Piers slammed Wayne Rooney’s wife by implying that she ‘may as well run into the street, scream out her secrets, and hope for the best that nobody runs to the papers’.

Coleen Rooney has two Instagram accounts, one ‘public’ and one ‘private’, and it is her private account on which she has claimed that her secrets were shared with newspapers.

Rebekah, a mum-of-four, was accused by Coleen of selling stories to newspapers.

Coleen made the accusations on Instagram, alleging that she set up a plot to expose her fellow WAG.

Rebekah has denied all the allegations and it has since been claimed that Vardy has called on lawyers to find out who had access to her Instagram and when.

Bin Laden took ten years to catch and kill because he only trusted a select few and shared nothing online (Picture: Universal)

‘I still don’t understand how the hell Coleen ever thought posting stuff on Instagram to 367 people was “private”?’ asked Piers.

‘It’s not. It’s public. If you truly want something to remain 100% private then I’m afraid you’ve got to take a leaf out of Osama bin Laden’s book and view all electronic communication, and social media in particular, as a clear and present danger to your privacy.’

Piers Morgan has some thoughts (Picture: Rex)

Writing for the Mail Online, he added: ‘I only completely trust about 20 people in the entire world, including close family members and long-time friends. They are the people I know for sure would never let me down, and who would get out of bed at 4am to help me if I was in trouble.

‘Yet I have 412 ‘friends’ on my personal Facebook account, the only private social media account I run. These include former work colleagues, newer friends, distant family and various celebrities, none of whom I would completely trust.

‘That’s not to denigrate them, or impune their honour, it’s just a reality check that if I suddenly posted something surprising like “Hi everyone, I’m gay and planning to announce my forthcoming civil partnership with David Hasselhoff on live TV tomorrow”, I would expect that revelation to become public in about three nano-seconds, possibly sooner.’

Colleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of selling stories to the press (Instagram)

Rebekah and Coleen became pals as their husbands played alongside each other for England.

Advertisement

Advertisement

However, on Wednesday Coleen sent shockwaves through the media when she alleged Rebekah had been selling fake stories about the Rooneys to newspapers.

‘Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories if they made their way into the Sun newspaper,’ shared Coleen.

‘And you know what, they did! The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flooding in my new house. ‘

‘It’s been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to,’ she concluded.

‘Now I know for certain which account/individual it’s come from.

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account.’
